Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address."},"balanceOf(address)":{"details":"See {IERC20-balanceOf}."},"decimals()":{"details":"Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}."},"decreaseAllowance(address,uint256)":{"details":"Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. web:/ipfs/QmdU5La1agcQvghnfMpWZGDPz2TUDTCxUwTLKmuMRXBpAx"]}},"version":1}

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `amount` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5.05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`). Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei. This is the default value returned by this function, unless it's overridden. NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

params._user: User to view the earned rewards for

returns.earnedAmounts: Amounts of the user's earned rewards

params._reward: Reward to calculate the earned amount for
params._user: User to view the earned reward for

returns.earnedAmount: Amount of the user's earned reward

exit().details: Burns all receipt tokens owned by the caller

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller. This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

notifyRewardAmount(address,uint256,uint2.details: Must approve this contract to spend the reward amount before calling this function.  New rewards will be assigned a id using their address and the block timestamp.

params._duration: Duration of the reward distribution in seconds

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

removeReward(address,address).details: All unclaimed earnings are ignored. Re-adding the reward will have a new set of reward information so any unclaimed earnings cannot be recovered

params._recipient: Address of the recipient that the removed reward was sent to
params._reward: Address of the reward to be removed

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._recipient: Address of the recipient that the removed token was sent to
params._token: Address of the token to be removed

rewardInfo(uint256).details: The active reward information is automatically selected from the id mapping

params._rewardId: Index of the reward in the array to get the information for

returns.duration: Distribution length of time in seconds
returns.rate: Distribution speed in wei per second

params._manager: Address able to call manager functions
params._whitelisted: Whether to add or remove from whitelist

stake(uint256).details: An equal number of receipt tokens will be minted to the caller

stakeWithPermit(address,uint256,uint256,.details: An equal number of receipt tokens will be minted to the caller

params._deadline: Timestamp of the deadline after which the permit is invalid

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: Overrides the ERC20 implementation to add the reward update

params._to: Recipient address of the token transfer

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: Overrides the ERC20 implementation to add the reward update

params._from: Source address of the token transfer
params._to: Recipient address of the token transfer

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdraw(uint256).details: Burns an equal number of receipt tokens from the caller

earned(address).notice: View the amount of rewards earned by the user

earned(address,address).notice: View the amount of a single reward earned by the user

exit().notice: Withdraw all of the caller's BIFI tokens and claim rewards

getReward().notice: Claim all the caller's earned rewards

initialize(address,string,string).notice: Initialize the contract, callable only once

notifyRewardAmount(address,uint256,uint2.notice: Manager function to start a reward distribution

removeReward(address,address).notice: Owner function to remove a reward from this contract

rescueTokens(address,address).notice: Owner function to remove unsupported tokens sent to this contract

setWhitelist(address,bool).notice: Owner function to add addresses to the whitelist

stakeWithPermit(address,uint256,uint256,.notice: Stake BIFI tokens with a permit

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Update rewards for both source and recipient and then transfer receipt tokens to  the recipient address

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Update rewards for both source and recipient and then transfer receipt tokens from the source address to the recipient address
